section.p: The examiners are thirteen astoundingly old men in dusty black robes. They sit at a long table studying the results of your first exam. Minutes tick by, then you hear a low snoring sound.
The senior mage raps his knuckles on the table, gathers some papers, and peers down at you.
‘We can’t admit you to the college,’ he wheezes. ‘You’re just too insufferably sanctimonious. You need to have an open mind to study wizardry, you know.’
You start to leave, but then another of the wizards says: ‘Wait. We can’t have you going straight off to bother another college.’
He casts a spell of transportation and you are flung magically across a thousand leagues in the blink of an eye, landing in a dungheap outside the town of Smogmaw. .
